page.title: 07Local History & Place Names
page.content: {FAMOUS PEOPLE} Admiral Cochrane (Lord Dundonald). Was born in Eddlewood House in 1775. This house was built in 1732 on the site of the manse attached to Eddlewood Chapel. The House is now a garage. {OTHER INTERESTING PLACE NAMES } "Chapel" Farm - Site of the chapel of Eddlewood. Waukenwae - From the Scots word "wauk" to full cloth. Muttonhole - Junction of two roads or rivers. Limekilnburn - Site of a lime-kiln - used to supply Quarter Iron Works. Cadzow - Obscure meaning, perhaps "battle of dark vale". Many farms have "muir" or "bog" in their names, suggesting the nature of the land around 150 years ago.
